title: In Munich, France and Germany present two visions for Europe while Rubio wants to 'build a new Western century'
subhed: Emmanuel Macron urged Europe on Friday to take pride in itself in the face of the Trump administration's repeated attacks. While highlighting European values, Friedrich Merz reiterated his commitment to the transatlantic relationship.
byline: By Elsa Conesa (Munich (Germany), special correspondent) and Claire Gatinois (Munich (Germany), special correspondent)

title: US Department of Homeland Security enters partial shutdown due to budget impasse
Arc de Triomphe knife attack highlights difficulty in monitoring radicalized former prisoners
Macron condemns France's 'antisemitic hydra,' which 'continues to grow'
subhed: Twenty years to the day after the premeditated murder of a young Jewish man, the French president delivered a speech on Friday expressing his desire to see the introduction of 'mandatory ineligibility' for elected officials convicted of 'antisemitic, racist and discriminatory acts and remarks.'

title: Saudi Arabia rethinks its cultural policy as foreign interests vie for funding
subhed: As the kingdom tightens its purse strings, French stakeholders have been working to protect their interests amid competition from the English-speaking world.
byline: By Roxana Azimi (Riyadh and Al-Ula (Saudi Arabia))

title: Mika opens the doors to his Tuscany villa: 'Throw us anywhere, and we'll make poetry'
subhed: The singer chaired the 41st edition of the Victoires de la Musique, France's annual music awards ceremony, on Friday, following the late January release of his seventh album, 'Hyperlove.' Currently on tour, he will perform in Paris on Monday.

title: Marseille mayoral election: Who's running?
subhed: Six main candidates are vying to win the mayoralty in the Mediterranean city of Marseille, in the municipal elections on March 15 and 22.
byline: By Gilles Rof (Marseille (France) correspondent) and Manon Romain

title: Nine people charged in Paris' Louvre ticket fraud scandal
Ex-president Hollande's 2027 presidential election comeback is fraught with obstacles
byline: By Olivier Pérou and Sandrine Cassini

title: How the Ivorian president's niece acted as Epstein's go-between

Don Lemon pleads not guilty to civil rights charges after covering a Minnesota church protest for his online channel
Bangladesh ends its authoritarian chapter as BNP wins parliamentary majority
byline: By Carole Dieterich (Dhaka, Bangladesh, special correspondent)

title: Winter Olympics 2026: US figure skating star Malinin stumbles, Shaidorov wins surprise gold
Eight to face trial in France over mass text message scam
Marine Le Pen's 2027 presidential rivals adjust their strategies to her legal timetable
byline: By Sandrine Cassini, Alexandre Pedro, Olivier Pérou and Marie Pouzadoux

title: Italian PM Meloni visits Ethiopia and confirms her ambitions in Africa
Ice hockey at the 2026 Olympics: A mountain sport looks to win over France's big cities
Why are major powers competing for control of the Arctic?
subhed: The Arctic has become a strategic focal point for countries, lying at the intersection of climate and geopolitical challenges. Climate change has sharply accelerated this transformation.

title: 'The decline in birth rates is a social phenomenon, not a woman's responsibility'
subhed: Instead of questioning the collective factors behind declining birth rates, the dominant narrative shifts responsibility onto women, laments Brigitte Grésy, former president of France's High Council for Gender Equality, and Micheline Misrahi-Abadou, professor at the faculty of medicine of Paris-Saclay University.

title: The Iranian protesters killed by regime gunfire on January 8
subhed: Sina Ashkbousi, Behrouz Mansouri, Mansoureh Heydari, Keyvan Moradi Mirani and Roubina Aminian were killed on the first day of protests against the Iranian regime. Their stories reflect both the diversity of the protest movement and the brutality of the crackdown.

title: The urgent need for a European strategy on economic sovereignty
A balanced choice on energy despite populist pressures
Jimmy Lai, a symbol of the end of freedom in Hong Kong
